Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Are we shooting people, or what?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: That's what I'm asking you.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I don't know the answer. That's what I'm trying to find out.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Dag.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: "Gettin' bugged drivin' up and down the same old strip, gotta find a new place where the kids are hip, I get around --"

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: It looked like the guy's head blew three feet into the air --

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: I said it looked like that happened, but then we got here and he was still breathing.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: And when it hits the ground, his hand keeps on firing.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Do you still want to sell pictures?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: For twenty.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: You're lucky you got to see anybody shot in this war.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: War's been over five days, Jim, ain't gonna be much more of this.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Troy's enemy, yours for twenty.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Accept no substitute, this is the real thing, oh, Jesus [winces] --

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I got a really bad headache all of a sudden--

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: No free pictures, motherfucker.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Is that what you got from this experience? A goddamn watch?

Speaker: havichon
Dialogue: Ees a great fucking watch.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: There's 700 million in gold out there and you're fucking around with a watch?

Speaker: havichon
Dialogue: Bon dieu de merde, that's a lot of gold, man.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: One bunker of gold and we retire from this horseshit, Hashy--

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: Gates.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Just a second. The problem, Hash, is how do you find it?

Speaker: havichon
Dialogue: Like one sowsan bunker out sair --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Maybe two sowsan bunker out sair, Hash, how do you find Saddam's bullion?

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: Could I have some help over here, for Chrissakes?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: My goodness, Bill, what seems to be the problem?

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: I'm trying to do a story here and the fucking sand is blowing in my face --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: You want me to stop the sand? I can't do anything about that.

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: No, you're too busy talking about the fucking gold, which by the way makes a great story if you'd get me a goddamn lead on it --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: I think the Saddam story goes more for the jugular, journalistically speaking, I mean, he's still here beating the shit out of his country.

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: Would you just be my guide and not my fucking producer? You're my guide.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: OK, go do your celebration story, Bill.

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: You're heroes.

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: You've exorcised the ghosts of Vietnam with a clear moral imperative --

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: Where the hell are you going?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: I'll be right back.

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: I don't want you helping other reporters, goddamn it.

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: Who's getting reemed? The Shiites?

Speaker: chopper pilots
Dialogue: '--be livin' here today because the flag still stands for freedom and they can't take that awayyyyy --'

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: And I'm proud I to be an American, where at least I know I'm free. And I won't forget the men who died, who gave that right to me. And I'd gladly stand up; next to you and defend her still today. Cause there ain't no doubt I love this land, God bless the U S A --

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Rahhhhhhhhhhhhhh.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Rahhhhhhhhh.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Rahhhhhhhhhhhhh.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: It's cool, no one's gonna hurt you --

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Did you rape and torture anybody in Kuwait, Abdul?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: You're making them all hysterical.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Take your fucking rags off, take this off. No comprende English, motherfucker?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: What is your fucking problem, Conrad?

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: I'm trying to git him to obey the spirit of things but he won't take his rags off.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Sir? We need you to disrobe like all the other towel heads, OK?

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Whoa, it's a freaky thing, Troy.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: There's a document in that guy's ass, Conrad.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: That's the freaky thing.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Do you think he ate it?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: It wouldn't come out perfect like that if he ate it.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Go get it, Private.

Speaker: iraqi officer
Dialogue: Hasa man timal!

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Open it up.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: You only gave me one glove.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I'm sorry I don't have another, but you gotta open it up. That's how the chain of command works.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: What the hell is that?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Important enough to squeeze your cheeks for.

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: You are a trained warrior, trained warrior, trained warrior, Jesus Christ, Colonel!

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: What's Bill got?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Just the celebration story.

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: That's it?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: That's it --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: How about you? Did you find anything?

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: It could be another bullshit lead but I need you to help me find a guy who might have something on the gold --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Who's the guy?

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: Somebody Barlow, maybe in Company B--

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Barlow.

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: Got a map out of a prisoner's head.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Out of a prisoner's head?

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: Or his ear, or his ass, or his dick, and they got like a fifty page full-color mini atlas of Saddam's bunkers --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Out of a guy's dick?

Speaker: general pye
Dialogue: This is not the way we service the media, Major. Stop her --

Speaker: mp
Dialogue: You are in violation of code 37D, grinding Major Gates.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: You guys have no manners whatsoever --

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: I told you he was with her --

Speaker: general pye
Dialogue: We're handling this, OK?

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: I wanted help with the gold story, and he took off on me--

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: That's a lot of bullshit.

Speaker: general pye
Dialogue: I give you a prestige job in the media war of the century and the guy feels neglected.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: I'm helping him plenty with his big celebration feature -- Where did you get this fucking star?

Speaker: general horn
Dialogue: They made me a general, pal.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: For what? I don't even know what we did over here, but Schwartzkopf gets a book deal, you get a star, Powell gets to be fucking president--

Speaker: general horn
Dialogue: Are you high? This is a huge win for us.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Running the press pool's a real big win for me.

Speaker: general pye
Dialogue: You want us to kill more Americans to occupy Iraq?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: I'm just saying it's ironic, that's all.

Speaker: general horn
Dialogue: What the fuck is ironic?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: We got the biggest army in the world here but Iraq still has the d-bag dictator in power, but that's how the world works I guess.

Speaker: general pye
Dialogue: Just take care of Smithson and maybe he'll hook you up to consult on movies.

Speaker: general horn
Dialogue: It's either that or be a security guard when you retire.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Fuck you, Ron.

Speaker: general horn
Dialogue: I'm a general now, you can't say fuck you to me.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: OK, sir, but there's another thing I'd like to say, if you don't mind.

Speaker: general horn
Dialogue: Go right ahead, Colonel.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Fuuuuuck yooouuuu, Ronnnnn.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: You've washed your hands like a thousand times, Conrad.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Lord knows what vermin live in the butt of a dune koon.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Why do you let this cracker follow you around?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: He's a good kid.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: He's a wall-eyed cracker.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: He's got no high school, man, he's from a group home in Jackson --

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I don't give a shit if he's from Johannesburg. I don't want to hear dune koon or sand nigger from him or anybody.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Captain uses those terms.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: The point is, Conrad, 'towel head' and 'camel jockey' are perfectly good substitutes.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Exactly.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: I'm sorry, man, it's a little confusing is all.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: What can I do for your headache?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Got any Vicadan?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: All gone. How about Caffergot?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Excellent. Let's translate my Iraqi ass map.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Van Meter's at the big pow wow?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: We're cool for at least three hours, but keep Walter on the door.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Would you take those fucking things off?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: I never got to use night vision.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: They don't work during the day and stand outside the tent.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: These are definitely Saddam's bunkers near Karbala.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: What's inside?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: According to Intelligence -- Picasso, Armani, Rolex, Mercedes, Sony you name it --  Kuwait was Muslim Beverly Hills and Saddam sacked it.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Man, get an awesome stereo system with like ten BOS speakers  --

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Silver Lexus convertible.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Lexus doesn't make a convertible.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Yes, they do.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Infiniti has one coming.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: You're wrong.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You can't get a car home from here anyway.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: If I get enough Rolexes I could buy one when I got home.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: One gold Rolex, I get a very fine split level outside Jackson.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: My one problem, see, is the risk here --

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: What risk? We already did the risk. I signed up last year to bank some computer training--

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Tell me about it.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Next thing I know I'm sitting here waiting to get hit by a Scud. I put my life on the line for what purpose I'm not sure, and now the good Lord puts this map in my path --

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: He could put a land mine in your path if we try to find this place --

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You're safe with me.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Cuz you have a galactic plutonium forcefield.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I don't talk about it. But I do have a ring of Jesus fire.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: You have a ring of Jesus fire.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I was fire baptized.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: I was baptized in water.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I'm fire baptized.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I don't even know what water baptism means.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: For those who understand, no explanation is necessary; for those who don't, no explanation will suffice. You can benefit from my Jesus ring if you do right by me, you got that?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: OK.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: This tent is restricted --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Get the fuck out of my way.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: May day, may day --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Good afternoon.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Would this be the proctology tent?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Yes, sir, I mean, no, sir.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Then maybe it's the urology tent.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Captain's at a staff meeting.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: That's OK, I'm not looking for a proctologist or a urologist I'm looking for Sargeant Barlow.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: You're on the path to truth when you smell shit, isn't that what they say?

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: I don't recognize you, sir. Are you in this division?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: He's not in this division. He's Special Forces.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: He's the guy taking Bill Smithson around.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: And you would be the Three Wise Men, right, Mappy, Slappy, and Pappy --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: That leaves Cappy outside.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Damn. Freeze. Do not pass. Hold it, freeze. Stop. Freeze.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: His name is Walter.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Did you good soldiers present this map to Captain Van Meter?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Not yet.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Then I'll take it to him.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: We'll take it to him. Sir.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: It won't do either of us any good then, will it?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: He's our commander, sir. We'd have to tell him you took it.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: It could be nothing but a sandy love letter from one Eye-raqi to another --

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: It's a series of bunkers near Karbala.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Maybe.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Not maybe, definitely. Recon photos match the map.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: May I look at the goddamn map?

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Dag.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: That's what makes Rangers badass, we get the best flashlights.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Still looks like a series of three bunkers in three villages. A bit farther to the west.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Seventy-five klicks north.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Much closer to Karbala.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Leave at dawn, back by lunch, not a big deal. Of course --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: -- there could be nothing inside but starving Arabs and stolen watches, but I think it's worth checking out, even if I have to do it with clueless reservists like you.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: I mean, I could take the map, but you could talk, it starts to become a pain in the ass for me, so we'll do the gold together.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: What gold?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: You don't even know what's inside these bunkers, do you?

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Rolexes.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Rolexes are swell, but I'm talking about Kuwaiti bullion.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: You mean the little cubes you put in hot water for soup?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: No. Not the little cubes you put in hot water for soup.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Gold bricks.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: 5 kilos each, $50,000 in today's market.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: For one gold brick?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: I'm sure Mr. Hussein has divided his bricks. into many different hiding places, but just one hiding place should be easy to take, and that would be enough to get us out of our day jobs. Unless the three kings are in love with their day jobs.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: I don't really have a day job.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: What about the risk of taking a Humvee and all that --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: We do this shit all the time.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: What else did you do, sir?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: In Panama we went sailing in Noriega's boats.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Wow.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: In Vietnam, we got a big gold Buddha, which we unfortunately dropped in a swamp by accident.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: What about Iraqi soldiers?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Let's see. They had the shit bombed out them for two months, they're deserting all over the place, and they've completely surrendered to us. That's a beaten army in every sense of the word.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: You are now under my command, salute --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: What's the guy's name outside?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Walter.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Cappy.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: You will take Bill Smithson on a special mission to find the gold story, but it will be a meaningless ride that lasts all morning and takes him nowhere near Karbala, is that clear?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: How am I gonna get out of the company?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Your captain will be detained by a friend of mine.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Is it true you got to take an enemy ear to be Special Forces?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: No, but if you talk to anybody about this, I'll kill you.

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: Very dashing.

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: Would you ever stand like that?

Speaker: cathy daitch
Dialogue: You'll get used to it. First question: did you dream as a boy you'd be commanding an infantry company in a desert war?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Pull.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Pull.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Pull.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I gave you a better arc, Doc.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I threw the ball in a higher arc that was easier for you to hit.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Bullshit.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Blacks make better receivers than quarterbacks.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Stop speaking right now, Conrad.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Warren Moon is an excellent quarterback.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: The Oilers have gone nowhere behind Warren Moon.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Randall Cunningham.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Don't get down in the mud with him, Doc.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: The Eagles will never get to the Superbowl with him.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Doug Williams took the Redskins to the Superbowl and won, OK?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: We can all agree there are many excellent black quarterbacks.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Hit it, you sorry-assed cracker --

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: This gun's too heavy to shoot one-handed like a movie star --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Shut the fuck up.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: When we pull up to the bunker, the approach is something called violence of action, which is standard in special operations. It means your movement is so fast and decisive that the guards are frozen and we haven't fired a single shot.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: We dropped a lot of bombs out here and we buried some guys alive --

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Bradleys with big plows cut through the berms and covered the trenches --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Let's rehearse.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: We'll say the cow is the primary guard outside the bunker. We pull up fast, and stop short.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Got it.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: And -- Go.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Who's hurt?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: It's all cow, I think.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Yeah, it's all cow.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: They said this was swept for mines.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Mines are forever, Doc. They never get all of 'em.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: 'If you could, help me Rhonda, help help me Rhonda --'

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Did you guys see any action at all?

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Only night bombing on CNN, except for Troy's supercool shooting that guy in the neck--

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Is sepsis cool?

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: What's sepsis?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Infection of the blood.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: As in septic tank, because that's what happens when a bullet hits you. The lead tears in there --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: But other than a wound that blinds, paralyzes, or castrates, the worst wound I've ever seen is something called tension pneumo thorax --

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I heard something about that --

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Tension pneumo what?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: A bullet, or a blade doesn't kill you, but makes a little hole in the lung, so every time you breathe, a little air leaks into the chest cavity, which starts to fill up like a balloon. And that balloon starts to push your organs to the side, crushing your lung, your liver, your heart. Your own breathing kills you, one breath at a time -- kinda like a job you can't stand or a bad lie you once told.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: That's not fatal, they can stop it.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: If you know how to make another little hole in the chest to let the air out, just like you would with an overinflated tire.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Can we play the Beach Boys when we go in?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: The goddamn Beach Boys.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I'm not ashamed of liking the Beach Boys. It calms me down. Better than Mozart.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Bach.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Where's the bunker?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: It should be right --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: There.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: No -- there.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: We are the Army of the United States of America. We are here to protect you. Remain calm.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Orders from President Bush, step aside.

Speaker: iraqi mother
Dialogue: No milk. Baby milk.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Do not panic.  Step outside --

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: We are here for your protection and safety.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Ya'll be cool now, this is the U.S. Marines in charge here.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Freeze.

Speaker: friendly iraqi
Dialogue: I am love United States of Freedom. I am hate Saddam.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Ya -- ya -- ha --

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Let him go.

Speaker: friendly iraqi
Dialogue: No problem, my friend.

Speaker: friendly iraqi
Dialogue: You look for the chemical weapon?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: No. We look for the gold.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Where's the gold?

Speaker: friendly iraqi
Dialogue: They move the gold.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Kill him.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Not yet.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Kill him now.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: friendly iraqi
Dialogue: This bunker. I'll take you.

Speaker: child
Dialogue: Ma-Maa.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Move. Out of the way.

Speaker: shiite woman
Dialogue: Hos-pital.

Speaker: shiite man
Dialogue: America help.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Give them MRE's.

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: This is boring, I already did this damn story, goddamn it, where the hell is the gold?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: How about rare pelican migration out by the marshes?

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: These brave pelicans are migrating in spite of massive pollution --

Speaker: bill smithson
Dialogue: Fuck that. Stop the bike.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I'm all right, I'm cool.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: What is the art of war, because it is not for killing people, it's a stratagem to give life to many by killing the evil perpetrated by a few -- I am burning up in this goddamn suit --

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Discriminating use of violence as a last resort, and even then, carefully, surgically, that's what I learned, that's what I'm good at. But now they underestimate all this, bomb the same towns for six weeks  and still leave the scumbag dictator to starve and butcher his own people.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I don't even know what happened back there. Civilians were spitting on their own soldiers; the soldiers were shooting the civilians and ignoring us --

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: They already surrendered to us. Now they're after Shiites.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: What exactly is a Shiite?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: They make up the ethnic majority but they don't have any power. When Bush pulled us out, he told them to start a civil war to bring Saddam down, and now they're getting wasted.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: The civil war? How could it be the civil war?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: It's a war inside the same country, Conrad. That's a civil war.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Put these on, we are now U.S. Marines.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I can't do this, OK? Because I've got a family and if I shit in a bag the rest of my life cuz I got shot after the war's already over that would be pretty fucking stupid, wouldn't it?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: What is the most important thing in life?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: What the fuck are you talking about?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Did you hear anything I said.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Respect is the most important.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Too dependent on other people.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Money.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Comes and goes, man.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: What is this bullshit?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: What's the most important thing?

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Necessity. That's what dictates what will happen at any given time in life. Necessity says we don't spend American lives taking out Saddam,  which leaves Saddam the necessity of taking out the Shiites so he can stay in power, which leaves us to take the gold.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: We could've been shot.

Speaker: archie gates
Dialogue: Did you notice they didn't touch us?  We decimated their entire country. They're scared shitless of us. [looks at his watch] There's time to try another bunker. I say we go.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Let's do it.

Speaker: vig
Dialogue: Rock and roll.

Speaker: troy
